text.p: by the Bureau of Meteorology, Brisbane.

warning-info.text: The next warning is due to be issued by 10:00 am (AEST) on Sunday 20th March 2016.

text.p: Issue Number: 5
Major flood levels are expected at Walkers Bend during the weekend.
No further significant rainfall is forecast.
FLINDERS RIVER:

River levels are continuing to rise along the lower reaches of the Cloncurry River between Canobie and the Flinders River Junction. Moderate flood levels continue to slowly rise downstream on the lower Flinders River at Walkers Bend.
GILBERT RIVER:

River level rises are occurring in the lower reaches of the Gilbert River between Miranda Downs and the Burke Development Road, with moderate flood levels occurring at Miranda Downs on Saturday morning. River levels further upstream on the lower Einasleigh River at Minnies Dip have peaked overnight.
FLINDERS RIVER at:
WALKERS BEND: Exceed the major flood level (5.6 metres) during the weekend. A flood peak of around 7.0 metres is possible, which is four metres lower than the flood peak in early January 2016.
Remember: If it's flooded, forget it.
For flood emergency assistance contact the SES on 132 500
For life threatening emergencies, call Triple Zero (000) immediately
Current emergency information is available at www.qldalert.com

forecast-period.text: For the latest weather forecasts see: www.bom.gov.au/qld/forecasts

hazard.text: MAJOR FLOOD WARNING FOR THE LOWER FLINDERS RIVER AND FLOOD WARNING FOR THE LOWER GILBERT RIVER
